00020 import os
00021 import os.path
00022 import glob
00023 from fnmatch import fnmatch
00024 
00025 def DoxyfileParse(file_contents):
00026    """
00027    Parse a Doxygen source file and return a dictionary of all the values.
00028    Values will be strings and lists of strings.
00029    """
00030    data = {}
00031 
00032    import shlex
00033    lex = shlex.shlex(instream = file_contents, posix = True)
00034    lex.wordchars += "*+./-:"
00035    lex.whitespace = lex.whitespace.replace("\n", "")
00036    lex.escape = ""
00037 
00038    lineno = lex.lineno
00039    token = lex.get_token()
00040    key = token   # the first token should be a key
00041    last_token = ""
00042    key_token = False
00043    next_key = False
00044    new_data = True
00045 
00046    def append_data(data, key, new_data, token):
00047       if new_data or len(data[key]) == 0:
00048          data[key].append(token)
00049       else:
00050          data[key][-1] += token
00051 
00052    while token:
00053       if token in ['\n']:
00054          if last_token not in ['\\']:
00055             key_token = True
00056       elif token in ['\\']:
00057          pass
00058       elif key_token:
00059          key = token
00060          key_token = False
00061       else:
00062          if token == "+=":
00063             if not data.has_key(key):
00064                data[key] = list()
00065          elif token == "=":
00066             if key == "TAGFILES" and data.has_key(key):
00067                append_data( data, key, False, "=" )
00068                new_data=False
00069             else:
00070                data[key] = list()
00071          else:
00072             append_data( data, key, new_data, token )
00073             new_data = True
00074 
00075       last_token = token
00076       token = lex.get_token()
00077 
00078       if last_token == '\\' and token != '\n':
00079          new_data = False
00080          append_data( data, key, new_data, '\\' )
00081 
00082    # compress lists of len 1 into single strings
00083    for (k, v) in data.items():
00084       if len(v) == 0:
00085          data.pop(k)
00086 
00087       # items in the following list will be kept as lists and not converted to strings
00088       if k in ["INPUT", "FILE_PATTERNS", "EXCLUDE_PATTERNS", "TAGFILES"]:
00089          continue
00090 
00091       if len(v) == 1:
00092          data[k] = v[0]
00093 
00094    return data
00095 
00096 def DoxySourceScan(node, env, path):
00097    """
00098    Doxygen Doxyfile source scanner.  This should scan the Doxygen file and add
00099    any files used to generate docs to the list of source files.
00100    """
00101    default_file_patterns = [
00102       '*.c', '*.cc', '*.cxx', '*.cpp', '*.c++', '*.java', '*.ii', '*.ixx',
00103       '*.ipp', '*.i++', '*.inl', '*.h', '*.hh ', '*.hxx', '*.hpp', '*.h++',
00104       '*.idl', '*.odl', '*.cs', '*.php', '*.php3', '*.inc', '*.m', '*.mm',
00105       '*.py',
00106    ]
00107 
00108    default_exclude_patterns = [
00109       '*~',
00110    ]
00111 
00112    sources = []
00113 
00114    data = DoxyfileParse(node.get_contents())
00115 
00116    if data.get("RECURSIVE", "NO") == "YES":
00117       recursive = True
00118    else:
00119       recursive = False
00120 
00121    file_patterns = data.get("FILE_PATTERNS", default_file_patterns)
00122    exclude_patterns = data.get("EXCLUDE_PATTERNS", default_exclude_patterns)
00123 
00124    # We're running in the top-level directory, but the doxygen
00125    # configuration file is in the same directory as node; this means
00126    # that relative pathnames in node must be adjusted before they can
00127    # go onto the sources list
00128    conf_dir = os.path.dirname(str(node))
00129    
00130    for node in data.get("INPUT", []):
00131       if not os.path.isabs(node):
00132          node = os.path.join(conf_dir, node)
00133       if os.path.isfile(node):
00134          sources.append(node)
00135       elif os.path.isdir(node):
00136          if recursive:
00137             for root, dirs, files in os.walk(node):
00138                for f in files:
00139                   filename = os.path.join(root, f)
00140 
00141                   pattern_check = reduce(lambda x, y: x or bool(fnmatch(filename, y)), file_patterns, False)
00142                   exclude_check = reduce(lambda x, y: x and fnmatch(filename, y), exclude_patterns, True)
00143 
00144                   if pattern_check and not exclude_check:
00145                      sources.append(filename)
00146          else:
00147             for pattern in file_patterns:
00148                sources.extend(glob.glob("/".join([node, pattern])))
00149 
00150    # Add tagfiles to the list of source files:
00151    for node in data.get("TAGFILES", []):
00152       file = node.split("=")[0]
00153       if not os.path.isabs(file):
00154          file = os.path.join(conf_dir, file)
00155       sources.append(file)
00156    
00157    # Add additional files to the list of source files:
00158    def append_additional_source(option):
00159       file = data.get(option, "")
00160       if file != "":
00161          if not os.path.isabs(file):
00162             file = os.path.join(conf_dir, file)
00163          if os.path.isfile(file):
00164             sources.append(file)
00165 
00166    append_additional_source("HTML_STYLESHEET")
00167    append_additional_source("HTML_HEADER")
00168    append_additional_source("HTML_FOOTER")
00169 
00170    sources = map( lambda path: env.File(path), sources )
00171 
00172    return sources
00173 
00174 
00175 def DoxySourceScanCheck(node, env):
00176    """Check if we should scan this file"""
00177    return os.path.isfile(node.path)
00178 
00179 # TDR (080522) - Swapped target/source based on scons.org docs...
00180 def DoxyEmitter(source, target, env):
00181    """Doxygen Doxyfile emitter"""
00182    # possible output formats and their default values and output locations
00183    output_formats = {
00184       "HTML": ("YES", "html"),
00185       "LATEX": ("YES", "latex"),
00186       "RTF": ("NO", "rtf"),
00187       "MAN": ("YES", "man"),
00188       "XML": ("NO", "xml"),
00189    }
00190 
00191    data = DoxyfileParse(source[0].get_contents())
00192 
00193    targets = []
00194    out_dir = data.get("OUTPUT_DIRECTORY", ".")
00195    if not os.path.isabs(out_dir):
00196       conf_dir = os.path.dirname(str(source[0]))
00197       out_dir = os.path.join(conf_dir, out_dir)
00198 
00199    targets.append(env.File( os.path.join(out_dir, 'foobar')))
00200 
00201    # add our output locations
00202    for (k, v) in output_formats.items():
00203       if data.get("GENERATE_" + k, v[0]) == "YES":
00204          targets.append(env.Dir( os.path.join(out_dir, data.get(k + "_OUTPUT", v[1]))) )
00205 
00206    # add the tag file if neccessary:
00207    tagfile = data.get("GENERATE_TAGFILE", "")
00208    if tagfile != "":
00209       if not os.path.isabs(tagfile):
00210          conf_dir = os.path.dirname(str(source[0]))
00211          tagfile = os.path.join(conf_dir, tagfile)
00212       targets.append(env.File(tagfile))
00213 
00214    # don't clobber targets
00215    for node in targets:
00216       env.Precious(node)
00217 
00218    # set up cleaning stuff
00219    for node in targets:
00220       env.Clean(node, node)
00221 
00222    return (targets, source)
00223 
00224 def generate(env):
00225    """
00226    Add builders and construction variables for the
00227    Doxygen tool.  This is currently for Doxygen 1.4.6.
00228    """
00229    doxyfile_scanner = env.Scanner(
00230       DoxySourceScan,
00231       "DoxySourceScan",
00232       scan_check = DoxySourceScanCheck,
00233    )
00234 
00235    import SCons.Builder
00236    doxyfile_builder = SCons.Builder.Builder(
00237       action = "cd ${SOURCE.dir}  &&  ${DOXYGEN} ${SOURCE.file} && touch ${TARGET}",
00238       emitter = DoxyEmitter,
00239       target_factory = env.fs.Entry,
00240       single_source = True,
00241       source_scanner =  doxyfile_scanner,
00242    )
00243 
00244    env.Append(BUILDERS = {
00245       'Doxygen': doxyfile_builder,
00246    })
00247 
00248    env.AppendUnique(
00249       DOXYGEN = 'doxygen',
00250    )
00251 
00252 def exists(env):
00253    """
00254    Make sure doxygen exists.
00255    """
00256    return env.Detect("doxygen")
